entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2001/9. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-E84: TÁRKI Omnibus 2001/9. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-02-12

entry.dcterms:description: 1) party preferences, popularity of politicians, evaluation of Prime Minister candidates, evaluating the work of the government and opposition 2) opinions about the EU accession, opinions about the international companies activities in Hungary, economic protectionism 3) workplace harms, knowledge about work protection, health damaging factors 4) reputation of the BOSS brand name and products 5) secureness of food 6) supply with infocommunication tools, computer and internet use
entry.dcterms:subject: information society
political institutions, public administration
economic systems and development
mass media
international politics and organisations
working conditions
science and technology
labour and employment
mass political behavior, attitudes
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
block 1: A, block 2: A, block 3: A, block 4: A, block 5: C, block 6: A
